# Template: Initial Letter to Executor or Solicitor

<!-- This template provides a framework for initial contact with executors or their solicitors -->

## Usage Instructions

**Purpose:** To make initial contact with executors or their solicitors  
**When to use:** Early in case preparation, before formal Letter Before Action  
**Important:** Customize all sections and remove placeholder text. Ensure tone is appropriate to circumstances.

---

## Template Letter

**[Your Firm Letterhead]**

**Date:** [Insert date]

**[Recipient Name]  
[Recipient Address Line 1]  
[Recipient Address Line 2]  
[City, Postcode]**

**By [Email/Post/Both]**

Dear [Sir/Madam / Mr./Ms. Surname],

**Re: Estate of [Full Name of Deceased], deceased  
Date of Death: [Insert date]  
Our Client: [Client name]  
Our Reference: [Matter reference]  
Your Reference: [If known]**

---

### Introduction and Purpose

We act for [client name], [describe relationship to deceased - e.g., "the deceased's daughter" / "a beneficiary under the will dated [date]" / "a potential claimant under the Inheritance (Provision for Family and Dependants) Act 1975"].

We write to introduce ourselves and to [state purpose - e.g., "make preliminary enquiries regarding the administration of the estate" / "put you on notice of our client's concerns regarding the will dated [date]" / "request information about the estate"].

---

### Background

[Provide relevant background - customize as appropriate:]

We understand that [brief factual background, such as:
- You were appointed executor under the will dated [date]
- A grant of probate was obtained on [date]
- You act for the executor(s)
- The estate includes [brief description of key assets if relevant]
]

---

### Our Client's Position

[State client's position - customize as appropriate:]

Our client [explain client's interest and position, such as:
- has concerns about the validity of the will dated [date]
- believes they have not received proper information about the estate
- is entitled to claim reasonable financial provision under the Inheritance Act 1975
- believes the estate is not being properly administered
- has concerns about [specific issue]
]

---

### Information Requested

[Customize based on what information is needed:]

To enable us to properly advise our client and in the interests of resolving matters without unnecessary cost or delay, we request that you provide the following information/documentation:

1. [List specific documents or information requested, such as:]
   - Copy of the will dated [date] and any codicils
   - Copy of the grant of probate/letters of administration
   - Estate accounts showing assets and liabilities
   - Inventory and valuation of the estate
   - Details of distributions made or proposed
   - [Other specific documents or information]

---

### Preservation of Assets [Include if appropriate]

We put you on notice that our client may [intend to challenge the will / make a claim against the estate / seek an order that you account for your administration].

We request that you take no steps to distribute the estate pending [resolution of this matter / our client's consideration of the information requested / further correspondence].

[If urgent]: We reserve the right to make an urgent application to the court for an interim injunction to preserve the estate if necessary.

---

### Alternative Dispute Resolution [Include if appropriate]

Our client is keen to resolve this matter without the need for court proceedings if possible. We would welcome your views on whether the parties might be willing to engage in [mediation / early neutral evaluation / settlement discussions] once the necessary information has been exchanged.

---

### Response Deadline

We would be grateful to receive your response and the requested information within [14 / 21 / 28] days of the date of this letter, by [insert specific date].

If you are taking legal advice, please confirm the name and contact details of your solicitors so that we may correspond with them directly.

---

### Costs

We should point out that if our client is ultimately successful in [challenging the will / obtaining provision from the estate / proving breach of duty], [they may seek their costs from the estate / you may be personally liable for costs].

We believe that the sensible exchange of information at this stage may help to avoid unnecessary costs for all parties.

---

### Next Steps

If we do not receive a substantive response within the time specified, we will need to consider what further steps are appropriate, which may include [issuing proceedings / making an application to the court / entering a caveat].

---

### Closing

We look forward to hearing from you.

Yours [sincerely / faithfully],

---

**[Fee Earner Name]**  
**[Position]**  
**[Your Firm Name]**  
**[Contact Details]**

---

## Alternative Versions and Variations

### Version A: Friendly Information Request

Use when: Relationship with executor is cooperative or client simply needs information

**Tone adjustments:**
- More collaborative language
- Emphasize mutual interest in proper administration
- Less formal about preservation of assets
- Focus on information sharing

### Version B: Formal Notice of Challenge

Use when: Serious concerns about will validity or executor conduct

**Additional elements:**
- Stronger language about preservation of assets
- Specific allegations or concerns detailed
- Clear warning about potential proceedings
- Reference to specific legal grounds for challenge

### Version C: Inheritance Act Pre-Action

Use when: Client intends to make Inheritance Act claim

**Additional elements:**
- Emphasis on limitation deadline (6 months from grant)
- Request for details of estate value for claim quantification
- Reference to Inheritance Act provisions
- Proposal for early settlement discussions

---

## Drafting Checklist

Before sending, ensure:

- [ ] All placeholder text replaced with case-specific information
- [ ] Client's name and relationship to estate accurately described
- [ ] Deceased's name and date of death correct
- [ ] Specific documents/information clearly requested
- [ ] Deadline for response is reasonable and specific
- [ ] Tone is appropriate to the circumstances
- [ ] Legal grounds mentioned are accurate
- [ ] Matter reference included
- [ ] Your contact details included
- [ ] Supervisor review completed (if required)
- [ ] Copy saved to matter file with appropriate filename
- [ ] Copy to client if appropriate
